Identifies presence of symptoms of depression.
Identifies the reasons for which the patient/family sought emergent care.
Identifies services or assistance a patient receives after discharge.
Identifies the reason(s) the patient was admitted to a nursing home.

Identifies whether the patient received an unscheduled visit to any (emergent) medical services other than home care agency services. Emergent care includes all unscheduled visits. A "prn" agency visit is not considered emergent care.
The groups or populations to which the patient is affiliated, as identified by the patient or caregiver.

Identifies payers to which any services provided during this home care episode are being billed. Accurate recording of this item is important because assessments for Medicare and Medicaid patients are handled differently upon submission than assessments for patients who do not have Medicare or Medicaid as a payment source. If patient is receiving care from multiple payers (e.g., Medicare and Medicaid; private insurance and self-pay; etc.), include all sources. Include "pending" payment sources if it is reasonably likely that they will provide payment during the episode.
Current payment sources for home care:Find:Pt:^Patient:Nom:OASIS
Identifies the patient's ability to safely transfer in a variety of situations. The focus for today's assessment - the "current" column - is on what the patient is able to do today.
Identifies presence of urinary incontinence or condition that requires urinary catheterization of any type, including intermittent or indwelling.
Urinary incontinence or urinary catheter present:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:OASIS

Identifies the patient's ability and the type of assistance required to safely ambulate or propel self in a wheelchair over a variety of surfaces. The prior column should describe the patient's ability 14 days prior to the start (or resumption) of care visit.

Identifies the patient's ability and the type of assistance required to safely ambulate or propel self in a wheelchair over a variety of surfaces. The focus for today's assessment - the "current" column - is on what the patient is able to do today.

Identifies the patient's ability to feed self meals, including the process of eating, chewing and swallowing food. This item excludes evaluation of the preparation of food items. The prior column should describe the patient's ability 14 days prior to the start (or resumption) of care visit.

Identifies the patient's physical, cognitive and mental ability to plan and prepare meals, even if the patient does not routinely perform this task. The focus for today's assessment - the "current" column - is on what the patient is able to do today.

Identifies the patient's physical and mental ability to safely use a car, taxi or public transportation. The prior column should describe the patient's ability 14 days prior to the start (or resumption) of care visit.

Identifies the patient's physical and mental ability to safely use a car, taxi or public transportation. The focus for today's assessment - the "current" column - is on what the patient is able to do today.

Identifies the patient's physical, cognitive, and mental ability to do laundry, even if the patient does not routinely perform this task. The prior column should describe the patient's ability 14 days prior to the start (or resumption) of care visit.

Identifies the patient's physical, cognitive, and mental ability to do laundry, even if the patient does not routinely perform this task. The focus for today's assessment - the "current" column - is on what the patient is able to do today.

Identifies the physical, cognitive and mental ability of the patient to perform both heavier and lighter housekeeping tasks, even if the patient does not routinely carry out these activities. The prior column should describe the patient's ability 14 days prior to the start (or resumption) of care visit.
Treated for urinary tract infection in past 14 days:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:OASIS
Unhealed pressure ulcer at Stage 2 or higher or designated as unstageable:Find:Pt:^Patient:Nom:OASIS-C
Formal pain assessment using standardized tool:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:OASIS-C
For what Reason(s) was the patient Admitted to a Nursing Home?
Does this patient have a Skin Lesion or Open Wound, excluding bowel ostomy, other than those described above that is receiving intervention by the home health agency?
Has this patient been treated for a Urinary Tract Infection in the past 14 days?
Treated for urinary tract infection in past 14 days:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:OASIS
To which Inpatient Facility has the patient been admitted?
Does this patient have an ostomy for bowel elimination that (within the last 14 days): a) was related to an inpatient facility stay, or b) necessitated a change in medical or treatment regimen?
Is this patient receiving Psychiatric Nursing Services at home provided by a qualified psychiatric nurse?

Patient/Caregiver Drug Education Intervention: Since the previous OASIS assessment, was the patient/caregiver instructed by agency staff or other health care provider to monitor the effectiveness of drug therapy, drug reactions, and side effects, and how and when to report problems that may occur?
Risk for Hospitalization: Which of the following signs or symptoms characterize this patient as at risk for hospitalization?
Patient Living Situation: Which of the following best describes the patient's residential circumstance and availability of assistance?
Does this patient have at lease one Unhealed Pressure Ulcer at Stage II or Higher or designated as "unstageable"
Unhealed pressure ulcer at Stage 2 or higher or designated as unstageable:Find:Pt:^Patient:Nom:OASIS-C
Plan of Care Synopsis: Does the physician-ordered plan of care include the following:

Episode Timing: Is the Medicare home health payment episode for which this assessment will define a case mix group an "early" episode or a "later" episode in the patient's current sequence of adjacent Medicare home health payment episodes?
From which of the following Inpatient Facilities was the patient discharged during the past 14 days?
Overall Status:Which description best fits the patient's overall status?
Influenza Vaccine: Did the patient receive the influenza vaccine from your agency for this year's influenza season (October 1 through March 31) during this episode of care?
Pneumococcal Vaccine: Did the patient receive pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPV) from your agency during this episode of care (SOC/ROC to Transfer/Discharge)?
Has this patient had a formal Pain Assessment using a standardized pain assessment tool (appropriate to the patient's ability to communicate the severity of pain)?
Formal pain assessment using standardized tool:Find:Pt:^Patient:Ord:OASIS-C
Pressure Ulcer Assessment: Was this patient assessed for Risk of Developing Pressure Ulcers?
Does the patient have a Stasis Ulcer?

sample.definition: LOINC Map to Code of the term that has superseded a term with a LCS value of DEPRECATED.

sample.definition: A value which indicates the content should be delivered in the named field/subfield of the HL7 message. When NULL, the data should be sent in an OBX segment with this LOINC code stored in OBX-3 and with the value in the OBX-5
